text: (bouncy blues music)
- [Bobby] Welcome to BBQPitBoys.com.

First off, we gotta thank
CitruSafe Grill Cleaner
for sponsoring this video.
We appreciate your support.

All right, today we're doing
some right-wing chicken wings
and they're real easy to do

with some of the tips
we're gonna show you here.

Now, we've got several
pounds of chicken wings

and the only thing we
have to do first here
is separate the left-wing chicken wings
from the right-wing chicken wings.

Now, if you've never had
chicken wings on the grill,

and you know, there are
actually people out there

who don't know how to cook
chicken wings on a grill,
you gotta check this out.

All right, so, we've separated
the right-wing chicken wings

from the left-wing
chicken wings, all right?

And in pursuit of justice,
you have to separate 'em.

They just might never get
along, all right? (laughs)

Now, of course, you want
to season the wings.

We're using our SPG, but you
use your favorite seasoning.
At least use some salt and pepper, right?
And we'll bring it to the grill.

Now, we're gonna be grilling
this on medium heat.

You don't want to cook
these wings too fast, right?
That'll bleed out the moisture in these.
So, take your time.

Now, we're using a Santa
Maria which gives us

unlimited control on the
amount of heat we want to get
just by raising or lowering the grate.

But of course, you know
about that, right? All right.
So, again, medium heat might be
325 degrees Fahrenheit underneath.
Now, this is optional, right?

I mean, you could serve
these wings without a sauce

but hell man, you're out
there barbecuing, grilling.
Get yourself some of your favorite sauce.
We're using our bold and spicy,
it's got a little kick to it.
Mmm, spread it on.
And in the miracle of time...
(satisfied exhale)

And after several flips
and turns and hitting it
with some more sauce, it is time to eat.
So, we're gonna pull 'em off the grill
because the temperature internal

is about 165 degrees
Fahrenheit, all right?
You wanna cook 'em to at least that.
(satisfied exhale)
Oh, man. You gettin' hungry or what?

And if you're not, you're
on the wrong damn channel.
(satisfied groan)
Every piece, pile it on.
We'll be eatin' good tonight, Martin.

Give us a call, we haven't
heard from ya in a bit.
All right, and of course, as always,

we do apologize for eatin'
in front of ya like this,
but we call this, "Pitmaster Privilege".
Now, if eating these right-wingers

is disturbing to you and
you prefer left-wingers,
just click that link below.
So, the next time you're looking

for a chicken wing recipe for
your pit, righty or lefty,

check out BBQPitBoys.com.
(bird cawing)
